ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Direct X , etc... (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: If they are programs like winzip or quicktime, they really don t ever expire, they just put that in there to scare you into buying their software!! =) Trust
ygData.messageBody:
If they are programs like winzip or quicktime,
they really don't ever expire, they just put that
in there to scare you into buying their
software!! =) Trust me, I've had winzip for about
3 years now and quicktime for close to a year...
lol! I'm not sure any can actually track you by
the date, although some software can limit the
amount of times that you can actually open it...
--- Thomas <Fuzhead@...> wrote:
> Thanks for the help everyone... the reason why
> it says July and June is
> cause i am using a trial version of some
> programs that expire certain
> features in 30 days so i just turned the clock
> back a bit :) hehehe
>
> Thanks-
> Tom
>
>
>
>
>
